characters: CREDIT SEQUENCE INTRODUCING THE GROUP HOME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in a circle is MASON, late-20s, a hug-able bear a_ good heart and sense of humor. JESSICA, 20s with a clipboard, quiet, confident and looks like she could kick some ass, and NATE, 20s, skinny and nervous as hell.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mean, day one’s always a little tough. It’s like, you know, no matter how the training goes, there’s always room for something that’s just totally unpredictable. (realizing) Oh, I’ve got a pretty good story for you if you’re ready for it.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Hey, what’s up?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Did you guys meet?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No. Nate.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: ...Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Okay, listen up, so, this was like, my first week on the job, and I'm at gate duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? Grace hops off her bike and walks it up to a small group standing outside of the building. Grace jumps in. Mason sees her for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: If a kid wants to leave, legally, we can’t stop them. So we put someone at the gate to try to talk them out of it.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Whoa. You got here quick.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Yes I did. Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Nate, this is Grace, she’s your new boss.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Hi. Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. She shakes Nate's hand.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I would lose the tie if I were you. And if you’re listening to a story of Mason’s, understand that there’s very little reality in it.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Hey, don't piss in the water before we put our toes in. Jessica hands Grace a clipboard of the night's report.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: (to Grace) Night shift was pretty mellow. She goes through it as Mason entertains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so, Grace, my wonderful new boss at the time. She leaves me at my gate duty for like 3 hours without a bathroom break, and I'm dying, because I ate the tacos that they serve here, and she failed to tell me that they're a known laxative. So, this kid, 16 years old, this big fucking intimidating dude, he’s like a foot taller than me, he walks up, and he just cruises out the gate. It’s my second day, so I don’t know what the hell is going on, but Grace? She's standing right there and she just let’s it happen.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Whatever, what I saw was Mason just sitting there, and Wesley smiling at me from the opposite side of the gate, because he knows that we can't touch him.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Once they’re a foot outside the gate we can't touch ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: So Grace tells me to follow him, so I do. For hours, just walking, 8 feet behind him. Eventually, he gets on this bus, so, I get on the bus too. And at this point, I can't think of anything but whatever the hell these tacos are doing to my bowels, so I make up my mind, fuck this, I got to get off at the next stop or I'm going to lose it in my shorts right in front of all these people. And exactly as I make this decision, Wesley leans his big-ass head over to me from across the aisle and he says really calm, "I'm getting off at the next stop, and if you do too, I'm going to rip your fucking balls off and feed ‘em to you."

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Remember what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Grace) Hey now, this part is true, I was there.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Really? Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Yeah. (to Nate) So, bus stops. He gets off. I wait a second, I go over to the door, but he’s just standing there on the sidewalk like 10 feet away, staring at me, waiting. What can I do? I have no other choice. So, I step off the bus, and the second that my feet touch the ground, it is like a knot in my asshole unties, and the fiesta in my stomach just comes pouring down my legs. Jessica, Nate and Grace can’t help buy laugh.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I’m just standing there, shit gushing down my thighs, I ruin my fuckin’ favorite Nike’s, and Wesley’s just there, doubled over, losing it. I mean, he’s fuckin’ laughing so hard - BOOM! The door from the unit flies open and Sammy comes running out in his underwear, swinging his doll around.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Wooooohooooo! !!! He takes off into the yard. Grace immediately takes off after him. Mason follows right behind.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Here we go Nate!

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Come on, Nate! Nate looks to Jessica, real nervous.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Go! Nate runs after them.  Grace and Mason begin to gain on Sammy.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Sammy! Sammy fakes them out a couple of times, making them work it. Grace finally gets close enough to grab him. Sammy hoots, like he's having a blast. Mason grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Let me go you fucking perverts! Nate catches up.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Nate, grab his feet please. Nate nervously follows directions, grabbing the boy's fee Together, Mason and Nate force him to sit down on the gra Sammy SCREAMS!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: We're just going to sit down here on the grass until you de-escalate.

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: De-escalate my asshole you duck fuckers! The three sit down in the grass as Mason smiles to himsel

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I'm not quite sure what you mean by that. Grace holds Sammy's feet.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You know the drill Sammy, just let it pass. Sammy keeps struggling, but quickly realizes he can't do anything.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: You alright buddy? Sammy breathes heavily. MASON (CONT’D) You got pretty far that time, I think it’s a new record. The three sit until things calm down.  And when it's finally calm, Mason continues like nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So anyway, after all that, he ends up coming back with me, but only because he’s so excited to tell everyone on our unit that I pooped my pants. And he does. He tells everyone, somehow it even got back to my mom. You heard that story, right Sammy? Sammy catches his breath...he shakes his head "no", then "yes", then no again.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: How you guys doing over there! Jessica watches them from the door.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Fantastic!

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: How ya feeling Sammy? You got it all out? Sammy looks exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You wanna go take a nap? Sammy nods.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright. Let’s get you up. (to Nate) Alright, i’1l see you back at the office. Nate nods nervously as she walks off.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Welcome to Short Term 12, man. Mason stands Sammy up.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A static shot of the "Cool Down Room," bobbing in the center. a toy punching bag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large girl, lies in bed, feet on the wall, head hanging the side, looking at the world upside down, filing her na with a non-metal file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl sits on the toilet (fully clothed) with wet hair wrapped in a towel, applying Nair to her legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One girl braids another girl's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCUS, 17, an intimidating quiet presence, sits on his b reading a science book. He pinches some worms into a fishbowl and watches his pet fighting fish gobble them up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUIS, 15, sleeps in bed with a pillow between his legs, drooling on his sheets. Family photos cover his wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few of the boys are at the sink, brushing their teeth a popping their zits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few of the girls are at the sink, plucking eyebrows w/ wooden tweezers, applying eye liner, brushing or flossing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMMY, 14 and small for his age, sits on his bed in only white briefs, playing with his dolls. Piled on his bed ar dozens of dolls and stuffed animals meant for a little gi A big American flag is stuck to the wall behind him. He grabs one of his dolls and makes her fly, standing up his bed and bouncing high. Holding her up into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace fills a Super-Soaker water gun with water, screws t container back onto the gun.  She looks down at herself, at her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace briskly walks into the office. She grabs a big red binder from the counter-top and hands it to Nate, waiting nervously on the side. She doesn't stop for him, heading the door.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: These are the files on our kids, to give you an idea of some of the crap they've been through. Nate begins to thumb through the binder as Grace looks in backpack.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: How long do they stay here?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Supposedly less than a year, but some have been here for over 3. We just keep ‘em until the county figures out where they go next. Grace pulls a pair of jeans from her backpack. She looks the window into the lounge and sees a kid lying on the co She pounds on the window.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tom! Go brush your teeth! She then turns to see Nate react to one of the files.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remember, you're not their parent, and you're not their therapist. You’‘re here to create a safe environment for them, that's it.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: And they're going to try to test you to see what they can get away with, so for now, just say no for a while.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You have to kinda be an asshole before you can be their friend. (beat) You're gonna be fine.  Grace walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Community meeting is in 5 minutes! (beat) Luis, you better be up! She storms into Luis's room, cocking her water gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace marches in to find Luis still sleeping. She rips th covers off him and pulls his pillow out from under his le She pumps the water gun a few more times and crouches to knee, taking aim like a Navy seal. Luis slowly opens his eyes and looks at her. She smiles a him coyly.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: So this is how it's going to be? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You got 5 seconds. Luis smiles.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: (in spanish) You don't have the balls. He closes his eyes with a smile. Grace aims for the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luis SCREAMS from inside his room and comes running out, chased by a cold stream of water.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: (laughing) Okay okay okay okay! Grace doesn't stop, laughing and chasing him all the way the bathroom. Mason walks down the hall, carrying a pile of folded towe A few other boys gather at their doorways with big smiles Mason shouts into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (spanish) I told you not to mess with her!  10 Grace shoots a stream right in Mason's face, puts the gun his pile of towels, and keeps walking down the hall. Maso takes it without flinching. MASON (CONT’D) I love you too. That’s not cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the kids are talking to each other as Grace takes a s There are 14 of them (7 boys & 7 girls) sitting in a circ Sammy is holding one of his dolls.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Kendra, can you be secretary for us today? KENDRA, a bored girl, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: KENDRA
dialogues.text: Sure, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Grace tosses Kendra a tablet and pencil to take notes.

dialogues.speaker: KENDRA
dialogues.text: Community meeting is now in session! (beat) Community announcements. Kendra surveys the room.

dialogues.speaker: KENDRA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No announcements? Grace looks around the room at the dead faces. No one wan to participate.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: What’s going on you guys? You look a little dead. She looks back to Mason.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What'd you do to them?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I don't know. I farted when I was outside, maybe some of it followed me in.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: You shart yourself again?  11

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: No, Luis, I did not shart, thank you very much. And that happened one time and you weren't even here yet, SO...

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: It's still funny.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Ok, are we done. I’ve heard that story like three times today.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s a good story.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: It is a good story.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay, well, if no one has any non- poop-related announcements, I have one. As most of you are already aware, Marcus is turning 18, and will be leaving us.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: (taunting Marcus) Can I have his room? Marcus doesn't like that comment.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: We're going to be throwing him a little party next week. Marcus, you have any requests? Marcus thinks about it for a second.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Can I shave my head?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I was talking about food for the party.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I don't want food, I just wanna shave my head. She shoots a look to Mason, who shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay, as long as I hold the razor.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That's cool. Cam holds on Marcus as Grace goes on.  12

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay, everyone else. Thoughts, food for Marcus’ party. What are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: Cheetos!

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Carne Fries!

dialogues.speaker: KFC
dialogues.text: All the kids begin to shout their orders in a chaotic cho

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay, okay! Everyone, one at a time! Luis raises his hand. Grace looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Luis, thank you for raising your hand.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: Who's that weird guy? Luis points to Nate.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Oh, that is Nate. Please do not be jerks to him. It is first day. (to Nate) You wanna introduce yourself? Nate smiles and waves.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Um, Sure. Yeah, um. As you know my name is Nate and I, uh, just, uh, I took a year off of school to get some life experience and I've always wanted to work with underprivileged kids.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Marcus, settle down.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: No, I wanna know what you mean by that ‘underprivileged’.  13

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: That's not what I meant.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Then think about your fuckin' words before you speak. Newbie.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Hey! That's a level drop. Go to your room. Marcus stares at her, letting her know he doesn't have to if he doesn't want to. Grace doesn't back down, not the least bit intimidated.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go to your room. Finally, he gets up and walks to his room.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Um, levels and feelings, you know the drill...let’s start with you Luis. She tosses him the little stuffed bear.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: Green, fine. As the kids each take turns tossing the bear and saying t levels and feelings, Grace looks off in Marcus' direction scratching the corner of her thumb with her fingernail. Mason notices her.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GROUP HOME LOUNGE-- LATER
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS. Grace picks up while writing a report on Marcus' blow-up.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Short Term 12 this is Grace. (pause) Right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace sits in an office, staring at a big, ugly, yellow l in the corner of the room. JACK, an old guy with glasses, finishes an email on his computer, typing very slow and l He talks while he types.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: So what do you think?  14

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The new lamp. She looks at the very normal looking lamp.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's really a trip. You can turn it on and off by just touching the metal part. Try it. Grace reaches over and touches the lamp a few times, taki it through its various levels of illumination.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cool, huh? He turns to Grace. Grace shrugs and gives him a slight nod that says, "Maybe little." JACK (CONT’D) Look I’m suppose to be in a group session like right now. You mind if we walk and talk? Jack gets up and grabs a couple folders from his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Grace walk down the sidewalk passing the cottage A small group of kids play dodge-ball in the foreground, supervised by a couple staff members. Kids and social workers pass through frame in the background. Jack fumbles through his folders and hands her a file.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: This is Jayden, she just got appointed to us this morning. Her father’s a friend of a friend. Real nice guy, very cultured.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Why isn't she with him?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: He lost his wife a few years back and Jayden hasn't made it very easy for him. The past couple years she's been in and out of group homes for dangerous behavior. Last week she bit her therapist's nose.  15

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, so we'll have her during the week, but she has weekend home visits.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I told her father we’d take good care of her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I take good care of everyone. Jack looks directly at her, a small smile on his face, reminding her who's in charge.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I know you do. That’s why I’m trusting you to do the same for Jayden.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (let’s it go) When does she get here? Jack looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: She might be here already. He walks into his meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAYDEN, 15, in worn jeans and high-tops with scribbles al over them, sits on the floor surrounded by all her belongings, drawing in a sketchbook, fixated on a dead ro lying on its back a few feet away.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I like your name, Jayden.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: It's a boy's name.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Really? I didn't think so.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Will Smith did. Grace goes through the last of her bags. She pulls out a belt and adds it to the pile of contraband. She pulls out pair of scissors.  16

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay, well these things you can’t keep in your room, but we'll keep it in a closet out here, and you can check it out whenever you want ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Yep, I know the rules: no belts, no razors, no scissors, no fucking freedom.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: No cussing.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Oh shit, I forgot about that one. Grace smiles at her and shakes her head, amused.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna let that one slide, only cause it was clever. Grace heads to the door.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's go see your room. Jayden watches her, wondering if this one may be differen

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Here it is. Jayden throws her stuff on the bed, including her sketch

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Wow, it's so inviting.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You can put up whatever you want on the walls, as long as it's appropriate.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: So no pictures of penises?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Not unless they're very scientific. Jayden walks over to check out the closet. Grace sees Jayden's sketch book and a really cool drawing of a dead roach with balloons tied to its feet, floating through th sky. Grace picks it up and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, wow. This is really cool.  17 Jayden grabs the sketchbook and closes it.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: That's crap.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: If you call that crap, I'm jealous. Grace takes in a breath and realizes Jayden doesn't want chat.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put your clothes outside the door before bedtime and the over- nighters will wash them. And, um, you can’t keep your door closed...

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: I don't do that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I'm not saying you do...

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: And if I did ever want to cut myself, keeping the fucking door cracked isn't going to stop me.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I warned you about cussing. That one's gonna be a level drop.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Oh no, a level drop, what am I going to do? Grace looks at her for a moment before responding.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Your attitude is not helping either one of us. Jayden puts in her headphones. Grace watches her for a moment, then walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kendra lies in bed, feet on the wall, filing her nails wi non-metal file. INT. SAMMY’S ROOM -- AFTERNOON Sammy plays with a plastic dinosaur. INT. MARCUS’ ROOM -- AFTERNOON Marcus stares at his fish.  18

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace signs out her hours for the day and puts the binder away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason stands with Nate, smoking a cigarette after work. N has a back-pack on. Grace unlocks her bicycle.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What happened to that guy?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: What guy?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: The big kid who made you poop your pants.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Wesley?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: He ran away again, and then two days later someone found him dead in the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: That's the real ending to the story.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I don't like that part. Mason takes a drag as Grace gets on her bike.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sure you're not coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I’m gonna clear my head. She rides off.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good first day Nate!

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (unsure) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) See ya!  19

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Alright, man

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Yeah, take it easy. See you tomorrow. He takes another drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace rides her bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace locks her bike to a railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace sits in a waiting room with 4 teenage girls. She's visibly awkward and out of place. NURSE BETH, a plump 40 year-old with a weathered face, walks out from the back w a clipboard in hand.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE BETH
dialogues.text: Grace? Come on in, hon. Grace gets up and walks back with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nurse Beth sits at her desk, looking at the testing resul on the clipboard. She has a kind, motherly tone in her voice.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE BETH
dialogues.text: So, the test did come back positive.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Lovely.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE BETH
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I already took like seven of those tests at home, so I’m not really surprised.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE BETH
dialogues.text: Okay, well you have a few options to explore. And we can go over them-

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Can we just make an appointment for Saturday?  20 Nurse Beth looks at her, wondering if she's really though through.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE BETH
dialogues.text: You don't want to hear the other options?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: No. Nurse Beth looks at her, looks down at Grace's hands.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE BETH
dialogues.text: Okay. She grabs another clipboard. NURSE BETH (CONT’D) Have you ever been pregnant before? Grace is a little thrown off.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: One time. Grace picks at the corner of her thumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace turns to see if anyone is watching her as she walks her front door. Grace stands outside her apartment door. She takes in a d breath, composes herself, practices a fake smile, and wal in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace walks into her apartment to find Mason, wearing a t chef's hat, cooking some authentic Mexican dish in the kitchen. He turns to see her and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Hey stinker, what took you so long?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (avoiding the question) Oh, no. I didn't know you still had that stupid hat.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I will always have this stupid hat.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: What's going on in here?  21

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Well since you were out cheating on me with your bike, I decided I'd make myself some chili rellenos, homemade tortillas, and my mom’s famous salsa. He uncovers the pot to let her have a whiff.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Mmm. Looks like there's enough for two.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: No, I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Mase, you don't have to be jealous of Floyd.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (laughing) Floyd? Your bike has a name now?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Of course he does. We're very close.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I don't know what you see in him.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Nice grip. Comfy seat.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: There is NO way his seat is as comfy as mine. Grace smiles and touches his arm apologetically.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You're right. I think I'm gonna go take a shower. (while leaving) Floyd got me all sweaty. Mason smiles and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I hate that bike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace sits in the shower, letting the water pummel her. S lets a glob of spit fall from her mouth. Lost. Empty. Sca  22

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two empty plates of (authentic Mexican dish) sit on the coffee table with a pot and wooden ladle. Mason and Grace sit on the couch, facing each other, sketching in two separate tablets. They both are glancing at each other and making adjustments to their illustratio

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay, I’m done with mine.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, okay. Yep, almost there.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: There’s some crazy last minute changes you’re making.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I really suck at noses.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. You go. She turns hers over. It's a really great drawing of Mason smiling with a messy beard and stick-out ears.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aw, damn it. Yours are always so good. (looking) I look like a homeless guy though.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You do kind of look like a homeless guy.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: What’s that on my face there? He points to a spot on his beard.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Oh, that. Well that’s the piece of avocado that’s on your beard.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (smiling) No, no. Fuck. He wipes the avocado off his beard.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: It’s been there the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Ooo, yeah. Thank you for saying something sooner.  23

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, alright here we go. Just take it easy okay cause you’re gonna freak out when you see this. I think it's my best one yet. Okay. Mason flips his book to reveal the worst portrait of some ever drawn. Grace is incredibly distorted, doesn't look anything like her, and has a HORRIBLE nose. Grace laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. You can’t fuck with that.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I can’t fuck with that.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That nose is amazing.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was going for kind of a mushroomy thing.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Is that a beard?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: No, I was trying to shade. I think it looks pretty cool.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: What’s going on on my head? She points to the bed of flowers growing out of her head.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: These? Flowers. They represent the peculiar thoughts that grow out of your gorgeous mind. Grace smiles. She meets his eyes for a moment and is reminded of how mu she loves him.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Why are you so nice to me?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Are we being serious now? Grace nods.  24

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, it’s easy. It’s because you are the weirdest, most beautiful person I have ever met in my whole entire life. Grace likes that. She leans in and gives him a really goo kiss. MASON (CONT’D) Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's just been a long time since you've kissed me like that. Grace thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Uh huh. We haven't had sex in 9 days and 13 hours.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Down to the hour, huh?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Did I do something? Grace shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: No, you're wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: What is it then? Grace looks away. She begins to scratch her thumb. Mason notices and gently holds her hand to stop her.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please, you’re gonna have to let me in your head every once in a while or I'm gonna go nuts... Grace grabs his face with both hands and shushes him.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Shhhh shhhh. Shhhh. She kisses him on the cheek, the nose, the corner of his mouth.  25 She pushes her lips against his and pulls him down onto t couch. She grabs Mason's hands and guides them, through h hair, her face, her neck, down her side, to her legs. He slides his hand along her skin, gently, carefully, always making sure that it's what she wants.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Are you gonna do this just for me? She kisses him again and moves his hand up her legs, high under her shorts. Her breathing quickens. He slides his hand down her belly, slipping into her underwear, pausing there, reading her skin like brail. She obviously wants h to keep going, but he waits for eye contact to be sure. S looks at him, her hand tapping the back of his head with anticipation. MASON (CONT’D) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Yeah? MASON (CONT’D) You don't want me to stop? She shakes her head, and then he touches her. She gasps. Mason kisses her again. Her legs pinch tightly around his hand. Her breathing quickens. The pleasure overcomes her and she loses control, pushing up against him. Eyes close gasping for air, squeezing his hair between her fingers. then.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (quietly) Stop.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Stop! Grace hits him hard with a straight palm to the nose and kicks him to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Ah! Shit! She quickly curls up into the fetal position on the couch Mason touches his nose, bright red and bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh...what the hell Grace?  26 She stays curled up on the couch without an answer. He gets up and walks to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason stands at the mirror, washing the blood from his fa He takes a moment to let the frustration go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason sits on the couch with Grace's head in his lap, stroking her hair. He holds his head back with a bloody tissue to his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace locks her bike to the gate and walks into the unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace sits in a circle with her 16 kids, Jessica, Mason a Nate observing.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay everyone, I think most of you have already met her, but we have a new member in our community. Jayden, would you introduce yourself?

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Um. Please don't be offended if I'm not very friendly, but I'm going to be living with my dad soon, and I don't really like wasting time on short term relationships, so you know, it’s nothing personal.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: Wow, she seems like a really nice girl.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Hey! I think we all can respect her space, okay? (beat) Okay, what do we wanna play for rec today?

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: Whiffleball!  27

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: No man, we always playing that stupid game.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: Because you always suck at it. Until you get good at it, maybe we can stop playing it.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Watch your mouth, bro.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (to Marcus and Luis) Both of you cut it out. (to the rest) Any other suggestions? Sammy, wearing a girl's top, raises his hand, which is holding a doll. GRACE (CONT’D) Yes, Sammy?

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: Can we play big and small?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Is that a real game or is that a game you just made up?

dialogues.speaker: SAMMY
dialogues.text: It’s a real game that I just made up.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay, maybe you can explain it to me later.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Straight guys! All the kids walk out the door in a straight line. Nate a Mason carry all the equipment for a game of whiffle ball. Grace walks up to Jessica and holds up a pair of latex gloves.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I'm gonna do room checks. So I’1l Meet you out there. Jessica nods and looks back to her kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace pulls latex gloves over her fingers.  28 An upbeat song bumps through Grace’s headphones as she go to work. She slides her hand across the top of the door, searches curtains, pulls open a drawer and looks under the clothes She flips through a sketch book filled with amazing, emotional drawings. She can't help but look through a lit more than she should. She finds a few sharpie pens and a bottle of black nail polish that she takes as contraband. As she leaves she shakes her head at Jayden's new wall de a few scientific illustrations of penis diagrams, showing the inner workings of the male genitalia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at all the dolls and stuffed animals on his bed begins to filter through them, squeezing each one to make sure they're clear. While looking through a “junk drawer” full of weird toys knickknacks, she finds an old PHOTO of Sammy and his sist when they were little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace takes a moment to look closely at Marcus's fish.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Hi Nas. She pulls all the covers off the bed and runs her fingers through them, squeezes a pillow, tilts up a mattress and looks underneath. About to drop the mattress back down, she notices somethi a small strip of tape. She reaches in and carefully peels off to reveal a small hole. She carefully pushes her finger in and after a moment of searching, feels something. She carefully pulls out a sma bag of marijuana, a pre-rolled joint, and a lighter. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are spread out in the grass. Nate crosses his ar like Jessica, trying to be a leader.

dialogues.speaker: KENDRA
dialogues.text: Come on guys. Let’s go Shawnta, let’s go!  29

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Alright, we got baseball here. There you go! You got this! Shawnta hits the ball into the outfield towards Sammy. Sammy's in the outfield looking at a bug (still holding h doll). The ball lands close to him.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: Hey, yo Sammy. Get the ball. Sammy looks up at the ball but doesn’t seem interested. The girl makes it to home. Mason walks up to Jayden, sitting in the grass with her headphones on. Mason sits down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: What? Too good for this game? She takes out one of her headphones.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: You too good for whiffleball?

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: I don't like sweat. Marcus steps up to the plate with the skinny bat.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: Hey, you know what Connor, just come closer. It’s Marcus, he ain’t gonna hit it.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You sure you don’t want to get the fat bat? No? Luis pitches the whiffle ball, taunting Marcus, who doesn swing.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Strike one, everybody. Strike one! He raises a finger to his teammates.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That wasn’t no strike.  30

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: That was right down the middle. This is the big leagues boy. Can't handle it?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Keep flapping them gums. Kendra and another girl run up to Nate with a jump rope i hand.

dialogues.speaker: KENDRA
dialogues.text: Hey, you wanna jump rope with us? Nate wants to say yes, but remembers what he's told.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: No? The girls turn away, defeated.

dialogues.speaker: NATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, we’re not suppose to...

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: That’s not what we meant.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (to Jayden) Can I hear? She apathetically hands him one of her ear buds. Grace arrives on the scene. She notices Mason sitting on sideline with Jayden, listening to the same ipod, bouncin the same beat. Luis pitches. Marcus swings and misses.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: Strick three! Change it up. Marcus does his best to curb his frustration. Luis brushe by him, tauntingly.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bet your mom’s excited to see you next week. Marcus cocks his head, wondering if he heard correctly. L keeps walking but Marcus spins around and swings. BAM! He clocks him hard on the back with the plastic bat.  31

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Marcus! Grace sees it and sprints to them. All the staff rush to scene. Luis winces in pain, spins around to face Marcus who grab him by the face and throws him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What’d the fuck you say about my mom you little bitch?! Marcus winds up to hit him again, but is pushed away by Grace. She gets right up in Marcus's face and pushes him.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Hey, Hey! What are you doing? Get your ass over to the bench!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Guys, get Luis out of here!

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Luis, come on, come on.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (to Luis) Where does it hurt? Nate and Jessica take Luis away. Improvisation: w/ game in session, Jessica and Nate are checking with Luis.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: (to Luis) You okay, man? How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Not good. I mean that was crazy. They just fight like that?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Nate. I’m not asking you how you’re feeling, okay.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Right. I’m sorry. (to Luis) How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game is in session.  32 Grace sits on the bench next to Marcus. They sit in silen for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You need to tell me what the hell is going on. Marcus doesn't look up. Grace reaches into her pocket and pulls out the bag of po she found earlier. She places it on the bench between the Marcus gets a little uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Assault and drug possession? You realize that’s enough to get your ass thrown in juvi.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You think I give a fuck?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You're out of here in less than a week. You’re so much smarter than this. I know it’s scary out there.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I ain’t scared of shit.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is, getting thrown in jail is not what you want to do. Marcus shakes his head. She looks off.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My dad’s been in there for 10 years. This catches his attention.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t want that for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the kids file back into the lounge, sweaty from their game of whiffleball. Marcus walks through the door.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Straight to your room Marcus!

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: No free time until all your chores are done!  33 Mason walks up to Grace after everyone has gone inside.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: What's going on with him?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: He doesn't wanna leave. Mason looks in Marcus's direction.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Should I go talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Alright, I'll be inside, letting Marcus kick the shit out of me.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Have fun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sits at his desk with his headphones on, writing lyrics in his notebook. Mason knocks on the door. Marcus pulls off his headphones acknowledges him with a head nod.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: You got some new lyrics you wanna try out on me? Marcus looks down at his notebook.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: There's a lot of fucks in it. Mason shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I won't tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason sits next to Marcus on the bed, playing drums on an upside-down, rubber trash-can. He starts a very simple hi hop beat.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Like that?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah.  34 Marcus begins to feel it, holding his notebook of lyrics. Then he spits it out. MARCUS (CONT’D) It don’t matter now, damn near eighteen, all the pretty pictures in my fucking head is faded. And when I think about that trick that raised me, I think about sick, cause the bitch is crazy. Fuck that bitch, nigger, fuck that pain. Your body’s in a ditch inside this turned up brain, I mean I can’t see how you claim it. You be a mom? doctor snatch me out the snatch, pair of evil eagle claws. Ho ho ho, slut, fuck the way you want it. Got your young dumb son pitchin pigeons for money. I mean is colder than the bitch when it’s sunny. Blow’s raining down on the globe, got the nerve to tell me you love me? I said again? Again? Sell it again? Bitch, I’m ten, let me go outside and function with friends. Marcus begins to pick up his intensity. Mason stops drumm halfway through, too caught up in Marcus's performance an raw honesty to continue. MARCUS (CONT’D) You say you ma? You mother? You tha father fuckin' queen? I say alright, I love her, so I flip it again. Nah, not this time, bitch, cause I’m stronger than you. Not this time, bitch, swinging harder than you. Nah, not this time, bitch, you ain’t leave me a choice, you just a body in a ditch in the brain of a boy. All fucked up now, damn near eighteen, all the pictures in my past ain’t never fading. I’m always wishing for something amazing, but when your life is shit, then there ain’t no trading. So put me in your book so you know what it’s like to live a life not knowing what a normal life’s like. Put a label on my head so you know what it’s like to live a life not knowing what a normal life’s like. Look into my eyes so you know what it’s like. Look into my eyes so you know what it’s like. Look into my eyes so you know what it’s like to live a life not knowing what a normal life’s like.  35 Marcus finishes, breathing heavy, staring at the floor. Mason is dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I don't even know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It’s cool, man. I just need to shave my head. You think Grace will still shave it? Mason's a bit caught off-guard by the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace knocks on Jayden's door. Jayden looks up from her b to see Grace standing with sketchbook in one hand.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I like the new wall decor. Jayden looks up, then glances at her penis diagrams.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Thanks. They’re actually very informative. Grace smiles and holds up her sketchbook.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Can I draw with you? Jayden looks at her, considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two sit on the bed, drawing portraits of each other i their sketchbooks.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: When I was 9 or ten, I used to draw portraits of all my mom's boyfriends and then I’d sell them to her for 10 bucks a piece.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: How many boyfriends did she have?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Enough that I was able to save up and buy one of those portable cd player with anti-shock protection. Jayden smiles a little.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: You're old.  36

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Whatever, those things were cool. Grace is lost in the memory.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know what’s weird? Whenever I was drawing portraits of those guys, I would always take forever. Like 30, 40 minutes, just stringin' ‘em along, like, “oh I just gotta do a couple more shadows, or finish fixing the nose.” I don't know why I did that...I hated every single one ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Maybe you were just trying to keep ‘em away from your mom. Grace thinks about it for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe. (beat) Are you done?

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) I just gotta do a couple more shadows, and fix the nose a little. Grace smirks.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You're such a little smart ass. Jayden smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: That's a level drop.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Not a level drop. I wanted to play foosball later.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Well, too bad. The two continue with their drawings, side by side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A razor slides across Marcus' shaven head. Marcus sits in a chair in front of the bathroom mirror wi towel around him and hair all over the place. Grace stand behind him with a razor, finishing up the back of his hea Mason stands beside her.  37

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay, finished. Wanna take a look? Marcus doesn't move, just stays sitting there, staring at floor. Grace looks to Mason.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: It looks great Marcus. Check it out.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Is it lumpy? Mason and Grace exchange another confused look.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Marcus still stares at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I usually keep my hair long, cause that's where she use hit me. (beat) Is it still lumpy?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: No way man, not at all. See for yourself. He stands up slowly and looks at himself in the mirror. H walks up closer, touches his head, feeling it, squeezing as if looking for something. He's amazed.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Pretty smooth. Marcus turns to Grace and Mason with a big smile. MARCUS (CONT’D) What about the back? No scars, nothing?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: It looks really great. Marcus looks at himself again in the mirror, then braces himself on the sink and begins to sob uncontrollably. Mason walks up to him and puts his hand on his back. Grace watches them, touched by the scene: he's going to b good dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace sits in the tub.  38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason and Grace lie in bed.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Mason. I have something to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: We're going to have a baby.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: We're going to have a baby. Grace nods, unsure of how he'll take it. He thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: We are?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Mmhmm.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Whoa. He sits up, then stands. He paces. MASON (CONT’D) Um, ah, give me a minute. Mason goes into bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, boy. Holy shit. Mason returns and looks down, notices Grace, senses her worry, bends to her, holds her hand in his, looks at her seriously and adult-like than ever. MASON (CONT’D) Hey. She looks at him. MASON (CONT’D) You know we can do this right? She doesn't give him much of a response. MASON (CONT’D) We are going to be some amazing parents.  39 She watches his eyes tear up as he looks at her with a gi genuine smile...he tries to fight the tears but loses it.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love you so much Grace... (shaking his head) ++.SO much it's insane. She pulls him close, hiding her face in his chest. As Mason glows with excitement, Grace still ponders what hell she's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Mason stand in the bathroom, brushing their tee They speak through bubbles and bristles.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Let me see. He tries to lift up her shirt, but she doesn't let him.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You can't tell yet.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Come on. She keeps brushing her teeth, then nonchalantly lifts up shirt to reveal her belly. Mason looks at it with a smile then puts his hand on it. MASON (CONT’D) That is so crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cooking timer goes off with a DING! Mason reaches int the oven and pulls out a batch of perfectly baked cupcake He has his chef hat on and an apron around his waist. He opens a can of strawberry frosting. He spreads the frosting over the final cupcake. Opens a can of sprinkles. He carefully applies the final sprinkles to the batch. Mason is deep in thought as he goes through the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace sits at her sewing machine, braiding 4 strands of leather to make a wrap-bracelet.  40 She scratches a letter from a letraset onto a button. We don’t see exactly what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (MS from back of car) Grace and Mason drive to work, holding hands. She leans o and puts her head on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace pops open a medicine container and dumps various colored pills into a paper cup. She fills a dixie cup wit filtered water from a pitcher. Jessica walks in and sits on the table, reading the repor as Grace preps the meds.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Did you hear about Sammy?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (concerned) What?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Last night they took away all his dolls. His therapist is calling it a lesson in "letting go."

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Those were all his sister’s, right?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (nodding) He's not ready for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy lies awake in bed in fetal position, sucking his th Grace comes in with his water and meds. When he sees her, pulls his thumb from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: It's time for your meds, Sammy. He doesn't move and she knows why. She sets the meds down and sits next to him.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry bud. She puts her hand on his shoulder, but he doesn't move.  41

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Jayden, Meds.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How'd you sleep? Grace hands her the meds.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: (apathetic) Like crap. She receives her meds and water and downs them like she's done it a thousand times.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you tell the doctor I need a higher dosage of trazodone. She hands back the empty cups.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Mmhmm, I will tell him. Grace hands her a gift bag.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday. She hands her a cupcake.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And it comes with this. Mason made it.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I heard your dad's picking you up.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You excited? She shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Whatever. Jayden turns and walks away. Grace watches her for a mome  42

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jayden looks at herself in the Bathroom mirror, adding a touch of make-up (this takes place in girl’s b-room). She puts on her shoes, laces them up, and makes sure her jeans fit over them nicely. She opens the gift that Grace gave her and finds a home-m bracelet with a button that has a “J” on it. She puts it adding it to her collection. She throws some clothes into her backpack and fits in her sketch pad. She zips it up and sits on the bed, waiting. We see her from outside the room, staring at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Jayden lying down, staring at the ceiling. Jayden gets up quickly, snatches her backpack and walks o into the lounge. (Camera follows her out)

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bye Shawnta!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jayden walks to an empty couch on the far wall and sits d backpack at her feet. She sees Shawnta standing at the doorway with her backpack on, getting picked up by her smiling aunt and uncle (a black family). Thom is also getting picked up by his uncle. Grace is at the door with them, saying goodbye. Then she looks over at Jayden, sitting sadly on the couch with her headphones on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica sticks her head out the door as Mason walks back the office. Mason gives her a big shrug. The yard is empty, no sign of her dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few of the kids are watching TV with Nate. Jessica walks into the lounge and shakes her head at Grac who's braiding a girl's hair.  43 Grace lets out a sigh and looks over at Jayden. Jayden sits in the same place, listening to her music. Sh looks down at her hand. She presses her thumbnail into he skin, carefully, with purpose, creating lines that begin form a word. Jayden finishes the carving in her skin. One last line. This time, she digs her thumbnail so deep she draws blood She pulls away and looks at her creation: WHY. The Y is bleeding. She takes one more look outside, then suddenly stands and streamlines to her room, SLAMMING the door behind her. All the staff react to it.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Damn it. Grace heads toward the commotion with Mason and Nate in t

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will you watch the kids?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Nate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace knocks on the door and then pushes slowly. She feel resistance.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Jayden, come on. You know you can't keep the door closed. (beat) Stop pushing on the door. Grace inches open the door enough to talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, Jade, I'm really sorry about your dad.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: (quietly) Why can't she close the door?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: She's a cutter.  44

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I can fucking hear you dick! Maybe I'll cut myself right now and you'll all lose your fucking jobs.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Come on Jade...

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don't call me fucking Jade you bitch! She slams the door shut again.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Jayden, come on. Please just open the door. If you just open the door then we won't bother you anymore. She doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you’re not going to open the door, we're going to have to force it. Grace motions for Mason and Nate to start pushing. They a slowly force the door open, inches at a time.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Wow Jayden, you're pretty strong. WHOOSH! The door flies open. Grace falls in, only to be greeted by Jayden's fist in full swing. She takes the first one square in the face. BANG! Color splatters across Grace's face as she slams into the wall. Jayden comes after her, but Mason grabs her in time

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: AAAHHH!! Get the fuck out of my room you fucking bitches!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Grab her right arm! Nate struggles to grab the other arm. He finally gets it.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, against the wall! They quickly back up to the wall in the hallway. MASON (CONT’D) One, two, three down!

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Don't fucking touch me!!!  45 They slide themselves and the fighting girl to the floor. They each pin her legs down with their own until she is virtually immobile, except for her vocal chords.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck yoooooo00000000uu! ! ! ! Grace touches her face and realizes she hit her with the cupcake. She pulls off the paper cup, which was still stu to her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus steps out of his room and looks down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the kids are playing video games on the couch One kid stands up to take a look.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Luis! Sit down!

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: AAAAAAAH!! You're fucking squishing me fat ass! Mason repositions himself.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Sorry, how's that?

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Let me go!!! Jayden gets one foot loose and tries to kick her way out. Grace grabs her feet.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be here, Grace.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: What's wrong Mason? Can't hold my feet yourself you weak ass fuck! You need the bitch to do it for you!

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Hold her good Nate.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Yeah hold me good Nate. Jayden spits hard on Nate's face.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Oh...cool.  46

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (calmly) Sorry man. Jayden catches her breath and begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: It's going to be okay Jayden. It’s going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: I fucking hate you.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: That's fine, you don’t have to like me right now. Just let it pass.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: How you doing Nate?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Not so good. Jayden continues to cry.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You're doing good. Doing really good. Grace takes a deep breath and exchanges a look with Mason

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Grace. How's my cupcake? Grace shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something else is playing on TV. Nate walks up to Jessica at the door.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: How is she?

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: She’s in the cool-down room now. I need that. Jessica grabs a bottle of quick-dry, antibacterial hand cleaner and squirts some in his hand. He immediately rubs all over the side of his face that Jayden spit on. Marcus walks over to the coffee table where the kids are playing a board game. He tosses a stack of colored paper pens onto the coffee table. The kids look up at him.  47

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Everybody grab one. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Jayden sit against the wall in silence. An inflatable punching bag, shaped like a smiling beagle, bo few feet in front of them. Jayden makes more creases in her hand with her fingernail Grace notices her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You wanna see mine? Grace pulls down her sock to reveal an ankle riddled with scars. She has Jayden's attention.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Shit. She points to a really big scar.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: That one's from a sneeze. I slipped and cut too deep. Almost cut my achilles. Grace laughs at the irony. Jayden looks off at nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Why? Grace shrugs, looking at the scars, remembering each one.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: When my mom died, I had to live with my dad...and... (beat) It's impossible to worry about anything else when there's blood coming out of you. They sit in silence for a moment. Jayden looks at her wrist, playing with the button of the bracelet Grace gave her. Grace notices her. Jayden looks up to the smiling beagle punching bag. She throws a soccer ball, hitting it square in the head. It slams to the floor and gently floats back up with a smile

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: God, I hate that thing.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Me too.  48 Through the small window in the door, we see Grace and Ja kicking and punching and throwing the punching bag agains the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace exits the CDR and holds the door open for Jayden. A they walk back to girls' side, she sees Marcus exiting wi Jessica. Jessica nods to Grace as they head back to the lounge. They reach Jayden's room and Grace stops at her door as s walks in.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Take as much time as you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jayden walks in and sees 14 hand-drawn birthday cards nea laid out on her bed. Grace watches her from the door with a smile. (Cue MUSIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixteen candles burn brightly, one in each of the 16 cupc that all the kids are holding together in front of Jayden All the kids gather around Jayden, singing the last verse Happy Birthday (or chanting Jayden, Jayden). They are all incredibly out of tune.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday to JAYDEEEEEEENNanana! Jayden blows out her candles and everyone claps loud enou to make her smile. When the room settles, Mason looks to Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire unit stands in a circle chanting together with their hands waving in the air. Mason leads them. As he chants they all clap and slap their thighs to the same rhythm. Nate joins in the group, very excited. This is hi kind of game.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Big booty big booty big booty. Big booty number three.  49 Mason sends the chant around the circle: "Number three, number 6" "Number 6, number 4" "Number 4, big booty" "big booty, number 2". Number two misses his turn and everyone laughs and teases him. Zero in on Jayden, who catches herself laughing and havin good time. Her face changes, watching everything from the outside. Mason starts another round, getting all the kids to lift their hands in the air and join in the big booty chant. Jayden doesn't join this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the game continues in the lobby, Grace walks into Samm room with a cupcake. Sammy lies in the same spot as befor staring into space. She places it on the bedside counter, runs her fingers through his hair before leaving the room. After she leaves, Sammy looks at the cupcake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The circle of kids are still keeping a rhythm. Jayden gets up and walks to her room. Grace watches her. Mason looks to Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Slow this down a little bit. Y’all ain’t go no rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. I’m trying to keep them in line. It’s just, it’s hard. Marcus begins to spit out some freestyle lyrics, teasing of the staff and the people in the circle. Nate is really into it, smiling and bouncing to the beat. When Marcus finishes, Nate immediately jumps in, picking up where he off:

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: I’m out the gate. Right my name is Nate. When I came here, y’all try to playa hate. Mason and Jessica exchange a what-the-hell-look. All the kids erupt with hoots and laughter as Nate and Ma break out into a friendly freestyle battle. Sammy peeks out from the doorway to see what's happening.  50 Luis is having a great time, momentarily forgetting about riff with Marcus. The crowd goes wild. Suddenly, an ALARM goes off. Grace and Mason exchange looks of confusion. Grace runs to the girls' side and sees the emergency door open at the far end of the hall. She runs to the door.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Everyone sit down please. We have an AWOL! Mason races after Grace. The other kids get up to take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace bursts through the door and looks around franticall She sees Jayden running in the distance with her backpack bouncing, turning the next corner.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Jayden! She takes off after her

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Grace!

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Stay with the kids! I'1l call you when I get her! Mason watches her run. Nate comes outside.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: This happens. It’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace chases Jayden down the sidewalk, but doesn't seem t gaining on her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Jayden, can you slow down please?! I feel like I'm gonna barf! Jayden's visibly tired, her backpack sagging on her shoulders.  51 Jayden looks back at her and begins to slow down. Grace d the same.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Keep the same distance!

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. They slow at the same pace, and then finally stop to catc their breath.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: You can't touch me outside the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Well, can I walk with you?

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Walk all you want, but I'm not going back there. Grace looks at her, still breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Let's walk then. Jayden takes a few more moments to cool down. Then, she starts to walk again. Grace follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit together at a bus stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit across from each other on the bus, neither of th talking. Jayden hugs her backpack on her lap. Grace waits for Jayden's lead. Jayden pulls the cord and gets off. Grace follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jayden walks ahead of Grace who follows patiently behind Then, finally, Jayden stops. She stands in front of a beautiful two-story house. The lights are off inside. Grace stops with her. Jayden walks to the side door of the garage, and Grace follows her. She reaches above the door and grabs a key f the frame.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Jayden, you know you're not supposed to be here.  52 Jayden ignores her, opens the door and goes in, shutting behind her. Grace doesn't follow. She takes out her cell phone and dials. Mason picks up.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Hey, we're at her dad's house. I don't think that anyone's here, but she went in anyway.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm on my way.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: K, thanks. Grace hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace sits on the front steps. After a moment, the front door opens and Jayden comes out with her backpack. She si down next to Grace.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: He's not here? Jayden shakes her head and hides it in her arms. Grace wr her arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you wanna go back? Jayden nods.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MASON’S CAR -- NIGHT Mason grips the steering wheel, driving slow and steady. looks in the rear-view mirror. Grace sits in the seat behind him with her arm around Jay who leans on her shoulder, staring out the window. Mason and Grace smile lovingly to each other through the reflection.  53

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jayden sits on her bed, exhausted. Grace walks in with he backpack and sets it next to her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: You okay? Jayden nods.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll see you tomorrow. She gives Jayden a side-hug and begins to leave.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: You wanna see a story I've been working on? Grace turns to her, a bit surprised.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jayden opens her sketchbook to the back page, where there a homemade pocket taped to the inside cover. She pulls ou folded piece of paper and opens it carefully. Grace watch her, patiently. She flips back through her notebook to a page that is cov with cool illustrations of underwater scenes and creature particularly sharks and octopi.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: It's a kids' story, so there aren't any big words.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay. Jayden begins. As she reads, she points to the illustrati that she wants Grace to look at. She points to a small sketch of a cute little octopus.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Once upon a time, somewhere miles and miles beneath the surface of the ocean, there lived a young octopus named Nina. She points to various drawings of the octopus making funn artwork out of shells and sand.  54

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nina spent most of her time alone, making strange creations out of rocks and shells. And she was very happy. (beat) But then, on Monday, the Shark showed up. She points to a drawing of a Shark swimming up to Nina.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "What's your name?" said the shark. Nina," she replied. "Do you want to be my friend?" He asked. "Okay, what do I have to do?" Said Nina. "Not much," said the Shark, "Just let me eat one of your arms." Grace watches Jayden read.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nina had never had a friend before, so she wondered if this was what you had to do to get one. She looked down at her eight arms, and decided it wouldn't be so bad to give up one. So she donated an arm to her wonderful new friend. Jayden points to a morbid drawing of the shark eating one Nina's arms.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every day that week, Nina and the Shark would play together. They explored caves, built castles of sand, and swam really really fast. And every night, the Shark would be hungry, and Nina would give him another one of her arms to eat. Jayden points at various illustrations of the octopus and shark playing together, and the shark eating her arms.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On Sunday, after playing all day, the Shark told Nina that he was very hungry. "I don't understand," she said. "I've already given you six of my arms, and now you want one more?" The shark looked at her with a friendly smile and said, "I don't want one. This time I want them all." "But why?" Nina asked. And the shark replied, "Because that's what friends are for." Jayden points to another drawing of the shark, alone.  55

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When the shark finished his meal that night, he felt very sad and lonely. He missed having someone to explore caves, build castles and swim really really fast with. He missed Nina very much. So, he swam away to find another friend. Jayden folds up the piece of paper and grips it in her ha She stares down at her drawings, waiting. Grace watches her for a moment before speaking.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Jayden, did your dad ever hurt you? Jayden doesn't respond at first. But then shrugs without looking up. Grace watches her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Does he still hurt you? Jayden doesn't respond. She hides her face with her hand. Grace sits with her for a moment before putting her arm o her back. She sees tears plopping down onto the drawings of the oct and the shark. The two sit side by side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push in fast on Grace writing a report of the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace drops off the copy of the report at Jack's office. is determined and confident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason drives with Grace riding shotgun. Both are dressed a party. Her head is on his shoulder. Grace lets out a breath.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: We can't let her go back there. Mason takes her hand into his and squeezes.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: That’s not going to happen. You were pretty amazing today.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Thank you.  56 They sit in silence, watching the evening pass outside th window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Members of Mason's family are gathered around the dinner table holding hands and singing a Spanish version of "Pra God From Whom All Blessings Flow". There are a variety of ethnicities present: Caucasian, Filipino, Black, Japanese But most of the people are hispanic. They all end with: "Amen." MASON'S DAD, a Mexican-American in his 60's, speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: MASON'S DAD
dialogues.text: (in spanish) Let's eat! The table is filled with a plethora of food: heaps of cra fish, seafood, shrimp cocktail, rice, salad, and some oth traditional Mexican dishes. People grab their plates and begin to dig in, eating and laughing together like a good family should. A father makes a plate for his daughter. A grandson pours drink for his grandpa. People are laughing, teasing, havi a great time together. One of the mothers approaches Grace, holding her one-year child over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Hey Grace, can you hold Sylvia while I make a plate for the other ninos? Grace is a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Oh, uh. Sure. The mother doesn't wait, but plops the infant into Grace' arms and heads to the table. Grace finds her footing, and looks down at the baby. She plays with its tiny fingers. Mason clinks his glass with his fork and soon everyone in room joins in.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (spanish) This is going to be short. I just have a couple things to say... (english) ...-And I'm going to say it in English so I don't embarrass myself any more than I need to. (to his parents) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just want to take a moment to say thank you. Momma, Pops. I don’t think anyone here thinks of you as just our foster parents. I don't even know what that term means... ‘Cause to us, you're just ma and pa. And I think I speak for everyone here when I say thank you, for taking us in... (laughs to himself) ..-For taking me in when I was a punk kid who was scared of everything...when I had no one else, you accepted me, and showed me what it's like...
