He begins to tear up a little, but pushes on. Grace watch him, moved by every word, holding the infant close to her

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-What it's like to be loved. None of us would be here, if it weren’t for you. He motions to the rest of the people in the room.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at this beautiful family you made... Mason takes a moment to look around the room.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (smiling) So let’s all lift your glasses to our king and queen. (turns to them) Happy 30th you guys. Everything good in my life is because of you. Everyone begins to hoot and yell as they drink from their glasses and go back to their conversations. Grace smiles at Mason as he wipes his tears and sees her the baby from across the room. He nods and smiles at the sight of her with a baby. She smiles and shrugs: it's not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Mason jump in the jumping castle with 4 of his little 8-year-old cousins. The kids laugh and jump on him He lifts a little girl into the air to protect her from t boys.  58

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salsa music fills the air and the dance floor explodes wi motion. One couple is really good, spinning and dipping a hopping together. Mason and Grace dance together, doing their own silly/crazy rendition of the salsa. They've mad up some of their own moves, like the tea cup tip, and the double hop. They're obviously great at being stupid and f together. Mason grabs Grace and holds her close, slowing their pace They dance near his parents. Mason's mom sends a friendly smile to Grace. Mason gets close to her ears and whispers.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Will you marry me? Grace pulls back and looks at him, sees how serious he is She's as ready as she'll ever be.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m dead serious. She smiles and nods, puts her head on Mason's shoulder an lets the moment seep through her pores. SLOMO wide-shot of the dancing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Mason lie in bed in the early morning light. Th phone RINGS! Both of them wake up.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Who the hell is calling on the land line? Mason gets up to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Hello? After hearing who it is, Mason turns his back to the bedr and lowers his voice.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is actually her fiancee, if this is about her dad, it'd probably be best if you let me relay the message. Mason listens intently as he's given the information. MASON (CONT’D) Shit. He rubs his head as he listens to the horrendous news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason walks back into the bedroom and finds Grace sitting the edge of the bed, facing the opposite wall. She knows he's there.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Who was it?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Um...someone from the probation department. Grace scratches frantically at her thumb with her pointer finger, waiting for Mason to say the thing she dreads mos MASON (CONT’D) He said your dad's probably going to get released next month. Grace lets it sink in. She hides her face in her hands. When she takes them away she leaves a streak of blood across her cheek. She looks at her thumb and sees it's bleeding. She touche her cheek and sees the blood on her fingertips. Mason climbs over the bed and tries to hug her from behin but she brushes him off and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands in the shower, violently scrubbing her skin wi rough washcloth. She holds the cloth to her face and scre as loud as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason stands out in the yard, smoking by himself. Grace shows up on her bike and he quickly puts out his cigarett and walks up to her.  60

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Hey, I really think we need to talk through some of this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Not right now Mason. I'1l be fine. I just need to work. She heads into the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica hands Grace the clipboard. She's eating cereal fr a plastic bowl. Nate stands by eating a banana.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Hey, Marcus's fish died last night.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: He thinks Luis had something to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Did he? Jessica shrugs. Grace heads out the door, determined to keep her shit together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Grace into the room as she goes straight for sleeping Luis and rips the pillow out from under him. Lui wakes up, slowly. Grace is in bad-ass mode.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Tell me you didn't do something to Marcus's fish.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Luis, tell me!

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. She stares at him to see if he's lying. He's kind of scar of her.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I swear.  61 She leaves as quickly as she came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace knocks and walks in. She finds Marcus sitting on th floor, writing in his lyric journal. In front of him is his fishbowl tipped over, with its contents spilled on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry Marcus. She watches him as he writes. His face is dark and broodi

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It wasn't Luis. Marcus shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It don’t matter. She watches him for a moment longer. MARCUS (CONT’D) I'd like to be left alone if that's cool with you.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay. (beat) Just let me know if you need anything. Grace keeps an eye on him as she leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace walks out of Marcus' room. She looks uneasy, like something is wrong. We move with her as she walks. She begins to pick at her bandaged thumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace continues to walk, the uneasiness building inside h the bubbling fear that everything around her is out of he control. A few girls walk from the bathroom to their room w/ towel their heads. Grace stops at Jayden's room and looks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jayden's room looks as it usually does, except she isn't there.  62

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace is a bit confused, looking around the hall for an answer. She sees Spring brushing her teeth in the doorway

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Have you guys seen Jayden? Spring shakes her head. Grace walks back to the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We continue to follow Grace as she walks up to Jessica, sitting at the door.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Jess, where's Jayden?

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Oh, her dad showed up last night and took her on pass for the weekend.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: What? Grace looks at the log in front of Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: Jack signed off on it.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding me? Grace storms out of the unit, heading for Jack's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace blasts through the door and walks straight into Jac office. Jack's on the phone but Grace doesn't care.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: How could you let her go? Jack realizes this is serious.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Uh, Jan, let me call you right back okay? He hangs up the phone and looks at her for a moment. JACK (CONT’D) The man called, he apologized. He had a personal emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not even the point, Jack. Did you read my report?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Of course I did, and I was very concerned. But when Jayden's social worker asked her about it, she said her father has never been abusive in any way.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Of course she said that, she's fucking scared! What the fuck do they teach you guys in grad school? Jack's a bit taken aback by her temper.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jack, in her mind, he is always right behind her, watching her, when she is sleeping, she is taking a shit, when she is alone with her therapist, he is right there, watching her, ready to pounce. And you just expect her to just come out and say it? Are you guys fucking stupid?! Because she was here asking for help and you just sent her back to the fucking shark! Jack is very offended by her language and temper. 63 He takes off his glasses and pinches the bridge of his nose and cl his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I realize you're upset, Grace, but yelling at me isn’t an effective form of communication. Grace realizes she won't get to him this way. She sits do

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay, Jack. Jack I'm sorry. Please. Cancel the pass until we figure this out. Because I know her, and I know that things are not good at home.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: And how do you know that? Because she read you a children's story?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Don't fuck with me Jack. I am on the floor every day with those kids. And last night, that girl sat next to me and she cried and she tried to tell me the only way that she knew how.  64

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Grace, you are a line staff. It's not your job to interpret tears. That's what our trained therapists are here for.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Then your trained therapists don't know shit!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Did she tell you that she was being abused by her father?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: She didn't have to!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: If I’m gonna take that child away from her biological parent, yes, she does.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: This is bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Grace, I have been working with these kids for longer than you've been alive, and there’s not one of them that I wouldn’t die for. I look into those broken eyes, I want to find the asshole who did that to them and beat the shit out of him. But although I feel that way every single day, I know I can't track down everyone who’s hurt them. I know I can't heal all their wounds. And I can't start accusing all their parents of being sexual offenders. Grace holds back her temper.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Especially when their friends of friends, right Jack? Jack looks at her, seriously.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We're finished here, Grace. Jack picks up the phone, dials, and swivels his chair so back is to Grace. Grace stares at him for a moment, then looks at the big, ugly, yellow lamp on his desk.  65

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey Jan- She grabs the lamp and walks out of the room. The electri cord pops from the outlet and drags behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow her out the front door of the main office, out the parking lot, where she lifts the lamp over her head a hurls it down onto the pavement, shattering it into a thousand pieces. Hold on wide shot for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate vacuums the couch, fluffing the pillows, sucking up the dust. He grabs one of the main pillows and flips it over. He stops. Sees something. Looks around to see if someone watching. Then reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate walks into Sammy's room, taking one more peek over h shoulder. He walks up to Sammy, who is lying in his bed, acting lik he's sleeping. He places one of Sammy's dolls on the bed next to him. Sa slowly opens his eyes, looks at the doll, looks at Nate. Nate smiles, gets up and walks out, looking back in time see: Sammy slowly wraps his hands around the doll and brings h close to him, holding it like his little sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace unlocks the back door and enters, sneakily, SWOOSHI the smoke back outside and airing out her clothes a bit. She walks over to Marcus's room. His door is closed, rap MUSIC blaring from inside. She opens the door and walks i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music surrounds her like a rush of wind. The room is empty, except for his fishbowl, now shattered pieces in the middle of the floor. She leaves the room, searching for Marcus.  66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits the room. Looks back toward the cool down room. Down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Marcus? Peeks into Sammy's room, then another...nothing.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marcus? Then, she sees him, sitting on the floor just inside Luis room.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marcus, what are you doing in Luis's room? Marcus doesn't respond, but just stares blankly at nothin And then Grace sees the large shard of glass in his hand, the blood covering his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh God. She drops to his level and pulls the glass from his finge Marcus stares off, holding in the tears. Grace reacts, moving quickly into the room. And then she sees Luis, lying face down on the bed, not moving.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Luis! Grace runs up to him.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Luis! She shakes him. Luis turns over and looks at her. He take out one of his ear phones.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: What? As Grace puts the pieces together, she hears a THUMP. She looks back to Marcus, who is now lying on the floor with streak of blood across the door behind him. She rushes to him.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: No. Shit!  67 Grace kneels next to Marcus and turns over his arm to rev the fresh cuts down his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit! Mason! Somebody! Anybody! Come! Help me!! She looks back to Luis, who looks really scared.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Luis! Luis, I need your pillow case right now! Give it to me! Luis rips off his pillow case and tosses it to her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Quicker please. Grace wraps the pillow case around Marcus’ arm. GRACE (CONT’D) Marcus, Marcus! Marcus, please look at me. Marcus, look at me. You're gonna to be okay. I just need you to look at me. Marcus, look at me. Grace panics.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck is taking so long?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group home sits silently in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are in the lounge playing a board game with Jess guarding the door. Luis sits on the couch watching tv, still shaken from the incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nate is on all fours in the empty hallway, wiping Marcus' blood from the door. He stops, suddenly, unable to go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace sits in the waiting room along with a few other inj and sick people. Grace is completely drained. Her hair is frazzled and she has Marcus's blood on her shirt. She sta off at nothing. A nurse walks by but doesn't say anything Mason walks up and sits down after talking to a nurse.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: They still don't know anything.  68 He rubs his head. Grace frantically picks at her bandaged thumb again. She nervously bounces her foot on the ground. She puts her he down for a moment, then quickly stands to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I can't do this. She walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Grace. Mason follows her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace walks out to the parking lot and begins to unlock h bike from around the street lamp.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Hey, Grace, where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I can't do this. Mason finally reaches her.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s go. I’11 drive us home. He tries to hug her but she shrugs him off and pushes him away. The gesture humiliates him.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I don’t want to go home. That’s not what I’m talking about.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I know it’s been a really fucked up day, okay?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Mason, you have no idea what I’m going through right now.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Then tell me. That’s how this works. Talk to me about it so that I can take your hand and fucking walk through this shit with you. That is what I signed up for, okay? But I cannot do that if you won't let me in. Grace shakes her head.  69

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I can’t. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (beat) You're sorry? (beat) Grace, are you serious? (beat) I’ve been waiting for you for a really long time, and I wouldn’t take a second of it back, because I love you so god damn much, okay? But I have been waiting for three years for you to tell me why you still don’t trust me. I’ve been waiting for you for three years for you to just once take the advice that you give your kids every fucking five minutes and learn to talk about what’s going on inside your head. You can’t do that for me? Grace shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, okay? Just talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I can’t do this. He watches her shift her weight, avoiding eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t...I can’t marry you. Mason stares at her for a moment, looking for something recognizable, but she just looks away.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t have your baby. I can’t do any of it. I can’t do it.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: So what do you want to do? You want to get an abortion?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I already made the appointment. The statement sobers him. He realizes this time it's for real.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Do whatever you want, okay? Because I'm done.  70 He turns and walks back to the hospital. Grace watches him go, the panic bubbling up inside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace flies down the road, peddling as fast as she can. A deep rage bubbles inside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace throws her bike in the front lawn and walks quickly toward the house. A beautiful silver Audi sits in the driveway. All the lights are off inside the house. She walks straig to the garage door, reaches up and grabs the key from abo the door. Her hands are shaking. She ignores it, opens th door and walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks through the garage, tripping over a bucket of sporting equipment with a BANG. Tennis rackets, balls, an an old baseball bat scatter across the floor. She stalls for a moment, staring at the metal bat, then instinctively grabs it and walks into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace walks carefully down the hall to the back room, her fingers quivering. On the wall is a happy picture of mom, dad and Jayden. She reaches the door, listens for a momen then carefully opens it and steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she slips into the room, Grace gets her first view of Jayden's dad. He sleeps on his back, chin to the ceiling, mouth wide op breathing loudly on the other side of the bed. Grace nervously grips her bat and walks around the bed to side, slow and quiet. She stands over him, looking down at his open mouth. Her grip tightens around the bat. Her breathing quickens as she positions the silver bat ov his open mouth. His hot breath fogs the shiny surface. She slowly raises it over her head, keeping her eyes focu on her target. Her hands shake with adrenaline.  71 She stands there motionless for a long moment, muscles twitching, sweat falling from her chin to the floor. She squeezes down on the handle, shifts her feet, and takes o last look at his face. Her body tenses.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Grace looks up and sees Jayden standing in the doorway looking at her. They stare at each other for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's a little extreme, don't you think? Jayden turns and walks down the hall. Grace stands awkwardly, realizing how stupid this idea wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still holding the bat, Grace walks out of the bedroom and to the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jayden and Grace sit together on the porch, like they've there for a while. Grace thinks about it, wincing at the thought of what she almost did.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Are you going crazy?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Probably. She starts to scratch her bandaged thumb, but stops herse with her other hand. They sit in silence for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When I was your age. She thinks about it for a while.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I stood in a courtroom in front of a_ bunch of strangers and told them all the ways he abused me...what he hit me with, how he got drunk, how he forced me to take a shower with him, got me pregnant, and I sent him to prison. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn’t talk about it, didn’t think about it...until I met you...I don’t know... (beat) I have a baby inside me and I don’t know, I don't know what I’m doing. Grace shakes her head. Jayden looks at her a little differently. This is a broke human being, just like her.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was just trying to help you. Jayden continues to look at Grace. Maybe she can trust he Then, she lifts up her shirt to reveal the fresh wounds across her lower back, swollen red stripes, bruised and slightly bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: He loves the belt, such a cliche.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Jayden, we have to do something about this.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: Should we go bash his face in with a baseball bat while he's sleeping? Grace gets the point. The question sobers her. Jayden looks back down.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Jayden points to her bat. Grace hands it to her. Jayden takes the bat and walks over to her dad's pristine silver Audi. Grace watches her wind up and swing, shattering the drive side window. She swings again and breaks the back window. Then she turns and holds the bat out to Grace.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: We should get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: He'll sleep through anything. Grace looks at the bat for a moment before taking it from Jayden.  73 She steps up onto the hood of the car, holds it above her head and brings it down on the windshield with a SMASH. She hits it again, SMASH! And again SMASH! SMASH! SMASH! Letting out all of her frustration until the entire thing demolished. She stands there as the bouncing cubes of glass settle on pavement. A dog BARKS across the street. Jayden notices.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay, now we should get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace packs Jayden on her bicycle as they cruise gently d the street. Jayden hugs her from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Jayden ride to the gate and stop. Jayden hops o as Grace parks the bike.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: They're going to ask a lot of questions. It’s gonna be hard.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: I'll try to leave out the part about you breaking into my house with a baseball bat. They share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: You're gonna be a really good mom. Jayden turns and walks into the facility, leaving Grace w that thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jayden sits in the office with Jack and a FEMALE SOCIAL WORKER, telling them the whole story.

dialogues.speaker: JAYDEN
dialogues.text: I told him this was going to be the last time I came home. I wasn't going to take his shit anymore. That set him off, of course. But I didn't care...  74 Grace watches them from the doorway. Jack notices her and gives her a knowing nod. She acknowledges him and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace rides home, light as a feather. She coasts down a long, steep hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace walks in and sees Mason sleeping on the couch. She walks over to him and kneels down. She sees he's not sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I didn't mean what I said earlier. I'm just really messed up right now. Mason looks at her for a moment, wondering. Then he lifts his blanket to make room for her. She slides in beside hi

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Marcus is going to get better. Grace nestles in a little closer.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I think I am too. They lie together on the couch, content in each other's a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace sits in a soft chair. She looks up at the therapist DR. HENDLER, a kind, older woman with a soft voice gives a moment before hitting her with the next one.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HENDLER
dialogues.text: Grace, I know talking like this is really hard, but this is our fourth session together and I'd really like you to try, okay? Close-up of Grace's hand, with her drawing of a sea horse She wiggles its tail.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: I don’t really know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: DR. HENDLER
dialogues.text: Your Dad’s getting out of prison in a week. Do you wanna talk about that?  75 Grace takes a moment.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason and Grace drive together in his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mason and Grace sit in a waiting room together, similar t the one at the WOMEN'S CARE CLINIC.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Grace nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace lies on the examination bed with a gown on. Mason stands behind her, holding her shoulders. They watch the doctor as he goes through the steps of the procedure like he's done it a thousand times.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Watch that monitor over my shoulder. There we go. There it is. Stay with it. Hang on a second. The doctor aims the monitor so they can see. He moves the ultrasound camera around on her belly to give them a bett view of their child.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's the heartbeat. The monitor shows a tiny being, with a flickering heart. Grace and Mason stare at it in awe. Grace looks at Mason with a smile. She grabs his hand and squeezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various shots. Music continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A static shot of the "Cool Down Room." The toy punching b is deflated and sagging. Luis lies in bed throwing a whiffleball against the wall. Jayden pulls down the penis diagrams and carefully tapes birthday cards up in their place.  76 Sammy stands in his underwear and carefully takes down hi American flag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grace and Mason stand in a circle with Nate. Mason and Grace are drinking coffee. Jessica approaches and hands Grace the binder as Mason te a story.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: So, you need to get ready for this ‘cause it’s so fucking unbelievable it's going to seem fake, but I promise you it's not. Grace will vouch for me.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: It depends, if you tell it right.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: There is no way not to tell this right, it's a storyteller's wet dream. Grace spins her hand in a circle, telling him to get on w it. Jessica comes outside.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Get ready for this.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Okay, just in time. I’m gonna start at the beginning, okay. So, three years ago, right, we have this girl here named, Liza Green, she’s 17, older than everybody else in the unit at the time, and I don't mean this in a pervy way or anything, but she’s real pretty. Mason looks to Grace for assurance.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: She was gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: All the guys on the unit want her but she won’t give any of ‘em the time of day ‘cause she was busy, she was always studying.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: She was very smart.  77

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Really smart. So, two weeks before she turns 18 and leaves, we get this new intake. This 15-year-old guy, he’s really tough, really quiet, but he’s cool, he’s just kind of like kicking back and checking out the scene. And I swear I didn't hear him say a word the whole first week he was here. But then one day, we’re doing a community meeting, and we ask for announcements, and this guy raises his hand. And he looks directly at Liza Green and he says, "I know you don't know me and I just got here, but I just wanna say that I've been watching you and I think you're the most interesting thing about this place. And I'm really sad I'm not going to get to know you before you leave. I just wanted to tell you that." Mason motions to Grace to confirm his quote.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: What a pimp. What did she say?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Nothing. Nothing, it got so fucking awkward I couldn't stand it, and then she left and never talked to him, and the kids teased him for like a year about it.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Ah, that blows.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Nah, he didn't give a shit. Didn't even phase him. Like he knew something everybody else didn't.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Who was this guy?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: That was Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: What! I never heard this story.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Oh, wait. It gets so much better.  78

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. So check this out. Grace and I are getting coffee at Ronnie's this morning, and we walk in, and who do we see sittin' there alone at a table, Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: How's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: He looks great.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: He’s so good.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Button-up shirt, he was sipping on a cappuccino.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: Marcus drinks cappuccinos?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Apparently now he does. Grace nods.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: So we're talking to him and we're catching up and he’s telling us about his new job at the aquarium and how much he takes home in tips and how he's gonna start applying for classes next semester and it’s weird ‘cause I’m like, I have not heard Marcus talk this much ever since I met him. Like what is the deal? Is he excited to see us? Is he nervous about something? And that’s when I notice there’s another cappuccino on the table and an empty chair next to him. They're all glued to Mason's every word. MASON (CONT’D) And then, just like in the fucking movies, the bathroom door flings open and out walks Liza Green! Everyone is smiling to the point of tears.

dialogues.speaker: NATE
dialogues.text: They were on a date?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: It was like their 5th one.  79

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Yeah, and as soon as she sits down, dude just goes beat red, so embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (to Jessica) It was so cute.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: It was so fucking cute I almost pissed my pants.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Oh Jess, they look so happy together.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: So happy. And there she is- BOOM! The door from the unit flies open and Sammy comes running out in his underwear, holding his big American fl over his head, screaming at the top of his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Here we go. Grace takes off after him. Mason, Jessica, and Nate try t keep up. Grace leads, hair blowing as she runs, gaining speed with every step. As she does, the sound of the wind grows louder, rushing her ears, slowly drowning out all other sounds until all can hear is the wind against her face.
